parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.66

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Arrays

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>Returns the array element with [[max]]imum numerical value. Engine solution to [[BIS_fnc_greatestNum]] and [[BIS_fnc_findExtreme]]. Therefore it is expected that supplied array consists of [[Number]]s only. [[Boolean]]s however are also supported and will be evaluated as [[Number]]s: [[true]] - 1, [[false]] - 0.  [[nil]] value treated as 0. 
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Warning </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Other non [[Number]] elements (not recommended) will be evaluated as 0 and '''Bad conversion: scalar''' message will be logged into .[[rpt]].</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value>'''selectMax''' array

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> array: [[Array]] - array of [[Number]]s

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Anything]] - element with [[max]]imum numerical value
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_max = [[selectMax]] [1,2,3,4,5]; //5</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>// Same as, for example: 
_max = _a [[max]] _b [[max]] _c [[max]] _d;
// Only faster:
_max = [[selectMax]] [_a,_b,_c,_d];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[selectMin]], [[min]], [[max]], [[selectRandom]], [[select]], [[selectRandomWeighted]]
</value></part></template>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 19, 2016 - 02:05 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Longbow|Longbow]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Returns either number or boolean value, in case max value in array 0, command will return either 0 or false, which ever comes first.
Same for 1 and true values.
<code>selectMax [false,0] // returns false
selectMax [0,false] // returns 0
selectMax [true,1] // returns true
selectMax [1,true] // returns 1
</code>
in case all values are equal or less than zero, command may also return other type of values
<code>selectMax ["",false,0,-1] // returns ""
</code>
if nil value appears in array, other values are equal or less than zero, command returns nil
</dd>
</dl>
